data: Battle of Hastings | Oxford Street | London

On an evening in 1866 (exactly eight hundred years after the Battle of Hastings) Mr. Henry Knight, a draperâ€™s manager, aged forty, dark, clean-shaven, short, but not stout, sat in his sitting-room on the second-floor over the shop which he managed in Oxford Street, London.
